title: 'When our teenager became overweight we had to resort to desperate measures'
text:
The only thing I remember clearly about our visit was the stony look on the doctor’s face. We were sitting there struggling to find the words to explain that we were desperately worried about our overweight 16–year-old teen. Although I can’t recall the exact conversation – I’ve now blocked most of it from my memory – I know we were trying to say it sensitively as we’d brought our son and he was sitting there in the consulting room with us.

I remember asking about safe eating plans for kids and the doctor not saying or offering anything. Instead we were ushered out of the room very quickly – none the wiser, but now just consumed with overwhelming guilt. What if, through this one doctor's appointment,...
